titleStmt.title: Christvs dei, or, A theologicall discourse wherein is proved that regall or monarchicall power is not of humane but of divine right and that God is the sole efficient cause thereof and not the people : also, that every monarch is above the whole common-wealth and is not onely major singislis, but major vniversis : written in answer to a late printed pamphlet intituled Observations upon some of His Majesties late answers and expresses.
titleStmt.author: Jones, John, d. 1660.

titleStmt.title: Christvs dei, or, A theologicall discourse wherein is proved that regall or monarchicall power is not of humane but of divine right and that God is the sole efficient cause thereof and not the people : also, that every monarch is above the whole common-wealth and is not onely major singislis, but major vniversis : written in answer to a late printed pamphlet intituled Observations upon some of His Majesties late answers and expresses.
titleStmt.author: Jones, John, d. 1660.
Morton, Thomas, 1564-1659 Supposed author.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to John Jones. Cf. DNB.
Attributed also to Thomas Morton, Bp. of Durham. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
